definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: A: I just got an answer about the stock we have on hand.
sentences.chinese: 我刚刚接获通知我们现有库存量。

sentences.english: Bellick tells Sucre that receiving drugs over the wall will add five years to his time.
sentences.chinese: Bellick说接获墙外扔进的毒品也会加刑5年。

sentences.english: She has received a written warning about her conduct.
sentences.chinese: 她已接获对她操行的书面警告。

sentences.english: Canto-pop star Gigi Leung received phone calls from an unknown caller who tried to blackmail her.
sentences.chinese: 歌手梁咏琪接获一名神秘男子电话勒索。

sentences.english: The left atrium takes in Blood from the pulmonary veins and sends it into the systemic circulation.
sentences.chinese: 心脏左侧从肺静脉接获血液，并将之送至体循环。

sentences.english: The acknowledgment package to individual sponsor will be implemented immediately upon receiving commitment of sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 在接获个别赞助者的承诺后，鸣谢安排立即推展。

sentences.english: We have not received your order since last October.
sentences.chinese: 自从去年十月我们就没有接获您的订单。

sentences.english: All vacancies received by the department are posted on the web site for public viewing.
sentences.chinese: 劳工处接获的所有空缺都会在该网站刊登。

definition: to receive a report/to receive intelligence, information etc
Taoyuan city in north Taiwan, capital of Taoyuan county
Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP), Canadian federal and national police force/Mounties
police station (abbr. for 警察署[jing3 cha2 shu3])
to find/to track down/to recover (sth lost)
National Police Agency (Taiwan)/abbr. for 內政部警政署|内政部警政署[Nei4 zheng4 bu4 Jing3 zheng4 shu3]
